briefTitle: Safety and Efficacy of PRX-102 in Patients With Fabry Disease Currently Treated With REPLAGAL® (Agalsidase Alfa)
officialTitle: An Open Label Study of the Safety and Efficacy of PRX-102 in Patients With Fabry Disease Currently Treated With REPLAGAL® (Agalsidase Alfa)
summary: This is an open label switch over study to assess the safety and efficacy of PRX-102 (pegunigalsidase alfa). Patients treated with agalsidase alfa for at least 2 years and on a stable dose (\>80% labelled dose/kg) for at least 6 months. Patients will be screened and evaluated over 3 months while continuing on agalsidase alfa. Following the screening period, the patient will be enrolled and switched from their agalsidase alfa treatment to receive intravenous (IV) infusions of PRX-102 1 mg/kg every two weeks for 12 months. No more than 25% of treated patients will be female.

primaryOutcome.measure: Number of Participants With Treatment-related Adverse Events as Assessed by CTCAE v4.03
